jx.jx_cn_mean: 毫无价值；不值一顾；为人所不齿

jx.jx_en_mean: judge someone to have committed the offence of contempt of court

lj.lj_ly: the advocate was held in contempt for subpoenaing the judge.
lj.lj_ls: 辩护人因传唤法官而被判藐视法庭。

jx.jx_en_mean: consider someone or something to be unworthy of respect or attention

lj.lj_ly: he wouldn't answer a woman he held in such contempt.
lj.lj_ls: 他不愿回答一个他如此蔑视的女人。

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from Latin contemptus, from contemnere (see contemn)

encyclopedia.content: contempt /kən'tempt/ DJ noun the feeling that sb/sth is without value and deserves no respect at all 蔑视；轻蔑；鄙视 ~ (for sb/sth) uncountable singular She looked at him with contempt. 她轻蔑地看着他。 I shall treat that suggestion with the contempt it deserves. 我对那项建议当然会不屑一顾。 His treatment of his children is beneath contempt(= so unacceptable that it is not even worth fee

entry.def: If you have contempt for someone or something, you have no respect for them or think that they are unimportant.

example.ex: He has contempt for those beyond his immediate family circle...
example.tran: 他鄙视直系亲属圈子以外的人。

example.ex: I hope voters will treat his advice with the contempt it deserves.
example.tran: 我希望选民们给予其建议应有的鄙视。

entry.def: Contempt means the same as contempt of court .

example.ex: Mr. Kelly was sentenced to six months in prison for contempt.
example.tran: 凯利先生因藐视法庭被判6个月监禁。

entry.def: If you hold someone or something in contempt, you feel contempt for them.

example.ex: Small wonder that many voters hold their politicians in contempt.
example.tran: 无怪乎很多选民看不起他们的政治家。

means.word_mean: 1. lack of respect accompanied by a feeling of intense dislike;

sentences.sentence: "the despite in which outsiders were held is legendary"

means.word_mean: 2. a manner that is generally disrespectful and contemptuous
3. open disrespect for a person or thing
4. a willful disobedience to or disrespect for the authority of a court or legislative body

auth_sentence.content: He was held to be in contempt of court.
auth_sentence.res_content: He was held to be in contempt of court.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: He was held to be in contempt of court.

auth_sentence.content: Laughing is a noted type of contempt of court.
auth_sentence.res_content: Laughing is a noted type of contempt of court.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Laughing is a noted type of contempt of court.

auth_sentence.content: The middle class contempt for the title of knighthood.
auth_sentence.res_content: The middle class contempt for the title of knighthood.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: The middle class contempt for the title of knighthood.

stems_affixes.word_buile: contempt[n.轻视,藐视;受辱,丢脸]+ible..的→adj.令人轻视的
contempt[n.轻视,藐视;受辱,丢脸]+uous……的→adj.表示轻蔑的,藐视的
tempt[v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣]+atious→adj.诱惑性的
at一再+tempt尝试→一再尝试→企图
con共同+tempt尝试→大家都能试下→没什么了不起→轻视,藐视
tempt[v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣]+ation表名词→n.引诱,诱惑;诱惑物
at一再+tempt尝试→一再尝试→企图
con共同+temn=tempt尝试→大家都能试下→没什么了不起→蔑视

stems_affixes.value_cn: 诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣
stems_affixes.word_buile: tempt尝试→v.诱惑,引诱;吸引,使感兴趣

sentences.en: Her contempt for foreigners was obvious.
sentences.cn: 她对外国人的蔑视显而易见。

jushi.english: Her contempt for foreigners was obvious.
jushi.chinese: 她对外国人的蔑视显而易见。

jushi.english: They would often look at us with unmistakable contempt.
jushi.chinese: 他们惯用明白无误的轻蔑眼光打量我们。
